title:
Corrections &
 
		
	Amplifications
description: Corrections & Amplifications for the edition of July 10, 2023.

title: Tulsa Race Massacre: Court Tosses Reparations Case
description: Judge dismissed a lawsuit brought by three survivors of the 1921 attack.

title: Avoid These Financial Missteps When Sending Children Off to College
description: Most parents are aware of the big mistakes, such as failing to apply for financial aid. But it’s the small slip-ups that can result in families taking a financial hit.

title: Several Execs From Joele Frank Launch New Firm With Deals Reporter
description: Ed Hammond, formerly of Bloomberg, joins new outfit focused on strategic communications.

title: More »
description: &#x22;Hamptons summer is like our Olympics.&#x22; It&#x27;s private chef season for the rich.

title: Yellen Trip Aids Fragile Effort by U.S., China to Keep Talking
description: Entrenched tensions will test Washington and Beijing’s resolve to move ahead.

title: How to Leave Grandkids Your Retirement Savings---and Not a Huge Tax Bill
description: The new rules for inherited IRAs might warrant a rewrite of your estate plan.

title: America Has Too Many Rules
description: Even after Trump’s cuts, overregulation plagues the country.

title: The Bidenomics Blather
description: His populist policies are similar to Donald Trump’s, albeit without the wall.

title: 'Nobody's Fool' Review: Against All Frauds
description: We tend to believe by default what we see and hear. But even if we can’t be nobody’s fool, we may become a bit less foolish.

title: Colonial Joe Biden Bullies a Neighbor
description: The U.S. opposed Guatemala’s election review because it had the winner it wanted.

title: Attorney Says Bob Huggins Didn't Resign as West Virginia Basketball Coach After DUI Arrest
description: Weeks after the Hall of Fame coach said he resigned in a public statement, an attorney for him alleged to university officials that it never happened and he wants his job back.

title: New Jersey's Wind Giveaway Gets Worse
description: Gov. Murphy is letting a Dutch company keep tax credits that he promised to residents to offset higher energy costs.

title: Biden Is Right on Cluster Bombs for Ukraine
description: Officials in Kyiv are best suited to weigh the risks to their own civilians.

title: A Teachers Union Has Odd Taste inBooks
description: The NEA’s ‘2023 Summer Reading List’ may make you regret that you ever learned to read.

title: China Puts a Bounty on My Head
description: The Communist Party is determined to silence me, even though I left Hong Kong three years ago.

title: East Coast Braces for Flash Flooding As Flight Cancellations Grow
description: More than 40% of flights scheduled to depart New York’s LaGuardia Airport were canceled

title: Judges Allow Tennessee's Ban on Transgender Healthcare to Take Effect---For Now
description: Court says a definitive ruling on a preliminary injunction is expected by Sept. 30.

title: Part 3: It's All Connected
description: Meet Kevin Feige, the president of Marvel Studios and the man who weaves all its films into one cinematic universe. The idea proves so popular that Feige becomes the most successful producer in modern Hollywood history. Meanwhile, rival DC Comics launches its own cinematic universe, led by director Zack Snyder. But can DC’s “Justice League” match Marvel’s “The Avengers”?

title: With Great Power: The Rise of Superhero Cinema
description: A four-part podcast series tells the story of how Marvel Studios, a once-bankrupt comics publisher, soared to the top of the movie business, generating billions of dollars at the box office.

title: Harvard Discriminates Against Middle-Class Kids
description: Legacy preferences hurt the less well-off but aid what really matters to the university: its endowment.

title: Ukrainians Die as America Dawdles
description: Fears of ‘escalation’ leave Russia feeling free to attack innocent civilians like Victoria Amelina.

title: A Revived NATO Comes to Vilnius
description: Putin’s war has revitalized the alliance, which would be even stronger with Ukraine as a member after the war.

title: Just One Original Frank Lloyd Wright Homeowner Is Left
description: Residing just north of New York City, Roland Reisley is the only person living in a house designed for him by the celebrated architect.

title: The Math Problem Stymieing Small Businesses in Rural America
description: The gap between real-estate appraisals and construction costs is getting wider, holding back entrepreneurs and the revitalization of rural communities.

title: Electric-Vehicle Startup Fisker Is Reborn Into a Crowded, Competitive Field
description: California-based Fisker is finally putting its first cars into the hands of U.S. customers, 2½ years after going public amid a frenzy on Wall Street for electric-vehicle makers.

title: Hong Kong Defends Its Hunt for Dissidents Overseas
description: The regime’s secretary for security responds to the Journal’s editorial.

title: Two Tales of the Supreme Court Term
description: Hadley Arkes sees in the Journal ‘a product of striking, even jarring, diversity.’

title: The Weak Evidence Behind 'Gender-Affirming Care' for Children
description: The Endocrine Society is ignoring the dangers that sex-change treatments pose to minors.

title: Why Do Both Parties Want to Lose in 2024?
description: Lord, please help Biden and Trump find something else to do.

title: It's Possible to Come Back From the Brink
description: The best way to stop homelessness is before it starts.

title: If Guns Don't Kill People. . .
description: Then we had better screen the people buying them.

title: Stock Funds Rally to 12.4% Gain for 2023 So Far
description: Quarterly Monitor: Funds notched a 6.3% advance for the second quarter in a top-heavy market.

title: Kremlin's Wagner Shake-Up Rattles Nerves in Africa, Middle East
description: The paramilitary group’s associates in the Central African Republic, where locals fear that rebels will take advantage of Wagner fighters’ departure, say a Russian presence will remain.

title: More »
description: The five books that will make you smarter about money

title: Biden's Next Dilemma: Union Jobs or Pricier Diced Tomatoes?
description: A potential levy on imported steel in food cans would help protect steelworkers but could lead to yet more price increases at the supermarket.

title: Don't Panic. Set Up Two-Factor Authentication So You Don't Get Locked Out.
description: You can prevent lockouts by using multiple forms of verification.

title: Five Books to Make You Smarter About Money
description: Young Americans, in particular, don’t know much about handling money. But they can fill the knowledge gap by reading these books.

title: Pope Francis to Elevate New Cardinals
description: The elevation of 21 men, including a U.S.-born archbishop, to the College of Cardinals, will deepen Francis’ imprint on the body that will elect his successor.

title: How Yves Saint Laurent's Moroccan Hideaway Became a Boutique Hotel
description: British designer Jasper Conran discusses his transformation of Tangier’s Villa Mabrouka.

title: America Is Wrapped in Miles of Toxic Lead Cables
description: Telecom companies laid them decades ago and thousands were left behind, posing a hidden health hazard today, a WSJ investigation found.

title: How the Journal Investigated Hidden Lead Cables Circling the U.S.
The AL All-Stars Suddenly Look a Lot Like the Texas Rangers
description: The AL West-leading team has six All-Stars thanks to a rebuild that’s ahead of schedule.

title: Lead Legacy: Share Your Story
description: The Journal is investigating the sprawling network of lead cables left behind by telecom firms and would like to hear from you.

title: A Soft Corporate-Earnings Season Poses Next Test for Stock Market Rally
description: Analysts expect S&P 500 companies to report their third consecutive quarter of declining profits.

title: With Great Power, Part 4: Endgame
description: A corporate civil war results in a breakup of Marvel’s longtime leaders. In today’s series finale: exclusive details in the fight for control over the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

title: He Pushed the New York Times to Buy Wordle. Now He Has to Make Sports Work.
description: David Perpich, cousin of Times publisher A.G. Sulzberger, was an architect of the subscriber bundle of games, a cooking app, the Wirecutter and sports-media site the Athletic.

title: Banks' Newest Fed Headache: Nonstop Instant Payments
description: Analysts warn that FedNow could upend lenders’ business models.

title: Congress Dives Back Into Fights on Spending Cuts, Military
description: Lawmakers face a stacked legislative agenda and an Oct. 1 fiscal deadline, marking a fresh test for Republican House Speaker Kevin McCarthy.

title: Recharged Bond Rout Unnerves Investors
description: A sharp rebound in U.S. Treasury yields is reviving old concerns on Wall Street.

title: Some Conferences Steer Away From Florida, Citing State's Divisive Laws
description: A number of conventions have pulled out of Florida over state policies that organizers describe as hostile to LGBT people and minorities.

title: Arts Calendar: Happenings for the Week of July 9
description: Tom Cruise accepts another “Mission Impossible,” NFL quarterbacks talk about life in and out of the huddle, Octavia E. Butler’s sci-fi heads to the opera house, and more.

title: Janet Yellen Says U.S., China Making Progress on Managing Economic Tensions
description: The Treasury secretary said Washington would listen to Beijing’s concerns on national-security issues.

title: Why the Ukraine Counteroffensive Is Such Slow Going
description: Outgunned, outmanned and facing a deeply entrenched enemy, Ukrainian troops are attempting one of the most daunting operations a military can undertake.

title: Amid Ukraine War and Internal Spats, NATO Seeks Show of Unity
description: Summit in Lithuania aims to showcase cohesion against Russia. But fights over Sweden joining and spending levels cast a shadow.

title: Last Mile of the Inflation Fight Will Be the Hardest
description: Lower housing and used-car costs are expected to push down the core index, but progress could then stall so long as the economy doesn’t weaken.

title: How to Leave Grandkids Your Retirement Savings---and Not a Huge Tax Bill
description: The new rules for inherited IRAs might warrant a rewrite of your estate plan.

title: Snap's Push to Tempt Creators Seems to Be Working
description: Social-media app Snapchat is trying to counter declining sales.

title: More »
description: The food is meh, the decor is bland and parking&#x27;s impossible&#x2014;it&#x27;s the favorite restaurant of America&#x27;s elite

title: You're Already Too Late If You Want to Book a Room for the 2024 Eclipse
description: Fanatics snap up accommodations for next April’s sensation; a Hilton Garden Inn in Texarkana for $743 a night.
